medical_history.chief_complaint: Midthoracic back pain after lifting an object during the seventh month of pregnancy, which persisted postpartum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The back pain began in the seventh month of pregnancy after lifting a nonheavy object. It remained with differing intensity postpartum, preventing the patient from lifting her baby. Physical therapy had no effect, leading to a referral to an internist three months after delivery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Severely reduced vision of the left eye since birth.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had postmenopausal osteoporosis, half-brother had three fractures during childhood after minor trauma, and grandfather had ankylosing spondylitis.
medical_history.social_history: Normal consumption of two to three dairy products daily; no history of smoking, alcohol, or medication use except for over-the-counter calcium and vitamin D supplements.
